data.name: Home_Privacy_PageTitle
data.value: Privacy: The Insolvency Service

data.name: Home_Privacy_Section1_Para1
data.value: This service is run by the Insolvency Service. We'll handle the information you give to us according to the provisions of the Data Protection Act 1998 and the details of the adjudicator’s functions registered with the Information Commissioners Office (ICO).

data.name: Home_Privacy_Section1_Para2
data.value: The official receiver (OR) is a data controller for the purposes of the Data Protection Act 1998 and is registered to process the personal data you enter when completing your application.

data.name: Home_Privacy_Section1_Para3
data.value: Most of the information the OR will hold about you will come from information you have given them. You’ll already know this personal information, but you can check if it’s accurate by sending a completed subject access request(MS Word Document, 145KB) to foi@insolvency.gov.uk.

data.name: Home_Privacy_Section1_Para4
data.value: You’ll receive within 40 days.

data.name: Home_Privacy_Section1_Para5
data.value:
If your information is incorrect and is likely to cause any issues, you should write to the FOI/DPA team with details on what needs to be updated.

FOI/DPA,
Technical Section,
The Insolvency Service,
1 City Walk,
Leeds
LS11 9DA

data.name: Home_Privacy_Section1_Para6
data.value: Further information on how the Insolvency Service and the official receiver treat your personal information can be found in the Insolvency Service personal information charter.

data.name: Home_Privacy_Section2_Heading
data.value: How we use your data

data.name: Home_Privacy_Section2_Para1
data.value: When you use our online service, the personal information you give to us will be used:

data.name: Home_Privacy_Section2_Para1_List1_Item1
data.value: to assess and make a decision about your Debt Relief Order (DRO) application

data.name: Home_Privacy_Section2_Para1_List1_Item2
data.value: to manage your DRO if your application is successful

data.name: Home_Privacy_Section2_Para1_List1_Item3
data.value: to list your DRO in the Individual Insolvency Register

data.name: Home_Privacy_Section2_Para1_List1_Item4
data.value: so we can contact you regarding your application or DRO

data.name: Home_Privacy_Section2_Para1_List1_Item5
data.value: so we can contact you to help us improve our service

data.name: Home_Privacy_Section2_Para2
data.value: We may also use the information you include in your application about organisations and individuals to contact them as required to manage your DRO. For example, we will need to contact your creditors using the details you provided to make them aware that you have a DRO.

data.name: Home_Privacy_Section2_Para3
data.value: Please note that the Insolvency Service can't provide legal or financial advice. You should seek this from a Citizen's Advice Bureau, a solicitor, a qualified accountant, an authorised insolvency practitioner, reputable financial advisor or advice centre.

data.name: Home_Privacy_Section3_Heading
data.value: Storing your data

data.name: Home_Privacy_Section3_Para1
data.value: Your data will be stored securely within the European Economic Area (EEA) while you complete your application and while your application is being considered. A copy of your information will then be transferred to the Insolvency Service's long term records, where it will be stored securely and used only as allowed by the Insolvency Act 1986.

data.name: Home_Privacy_Section3_Para2
data.value: We may share the information in your application with your creditors, their representatives, government departments, agencies, organisations or individuals if we're required to do so by law. For example, we will share your personal details with an insolvency practitioner should one be appointed as your trustee instead of the official receiver.

data.name: Home_Privacy_Section3_Para3
data.value: We’ll never share your information with other organisations for marketing, market research or commercial purposes, and we don’t pass on your personal information to any other websites.

data.name: Home_Privacy_Section4_Heading
data.value: Online payments

data.name: Home_Privacy_Section4_Para1
data.value: If you choose to pay the application fee online, you will be directed to our payment partner, WorldPay, for the payment to be processed. The details you give them will be encrypted in line with the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI-DSS).

data.name: Home_Privacy_Section4_Para2
data.value:
The Insolvency Service won’t store any of your payment card details and isn't liable for any
information you enter into WorldPay’s pages. To pay online you must abide by WorldPay’s terms
and conditions, which you can read here along with some frequently, asked questions:

data.name: Home_Privacy_Section4_Para2_List1_Item1
data.value: WorldPay website terms and conditions

data.name: Home_Privacy_Section4_Para2_List1_Item2
data.value: WorldPay shopper FAQs

data.name: Home_Privacy_Section5_Heading
data.value: Credit search

data.name: Home_Privacy_Section5_Para1
data.value: When you submit your application, the OR will run a credit search on you with the credit reference agency Experian. The OR uses this search to check that the information in your application is correct, not to find out your credit score. The search won’t affect your credit rating, and the results won’t be shared with anyone outside the Insolvency Service.

data.name: Home_Privacy_Section5_Para2
data.value: Experian will keep a record of the search for 12 months. This also won’t affect your credit rating. You can find information about and contact details for Equifax at www.experian.co.uk.
